    • Constructor Detail

      • FileIndexer

        FileIndexer()
     throws java.io.IOException
        The constructor of our class, initialized needed variables.

        The constructor gets the absolute path to the .jar file being run and sets it as the index directory. Also initializes other needed members like the mWriter.

        Throws:

    • Method Detail

      • indexDirectory

        public void indexDirectory(java.lang.String directory)
                    throws java.io.IOException
        Indexes "all" files in the specified URI directory. The directory argument must specify an absolute URI.

        This method crawls trough all folders in the specified directory and takes all files ending with .TXT or .HTML and indexes them. For HTML files it looks for the first occurrence of the tag "summary" and saves the containing text in the datatype Document for the specific file. The same is done for the first occurrence of a "time" tag with the attribute "datetime" e.g. <time datetime="1914"> It then save the value of the attribute in the same manner as it is done for the summary tag

        Parameters:
        directory - the URI to the directory which contains the files to be indexed
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException

      • search

        public void search(java.lang.String searchquery)
            throws java.io.IOException,
                   org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.ParseException
        Searches for the specified query in our created index. The searchquery argument must specify a string to be looked for.

        This method looks for the specified string query in our index and prints out all files containg this file with additional information. For all files it returns the Rank, Path to the file, the Score and the time it was last modified. Additionally for HTML files it returns the Title and a Summary.

        Parameters:
        searchquery - the String which shall be looked for in the created index
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.ParseException

      • main

        public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
                 throws java.io.IOException,
                        org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.ParseException
        Creates an objects of our FileIndexer class and uses it for indexing and searching. The args argument must contain the directory as absolute URI at first place where the files are that shall be indexed.

        Creates an object of the FileIndexer class, takes the directory from the args argument and uses it with a method to index all files. Then it takes input as a search query and uses a method to search for the query in our index.

        Parameters:
        args - the directory at first place where the files are that shall be indexed.
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
        org.apache.lucene.queryparser.classic.ParseException
